definition: to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch

sentences.english: He that first cries out stop thief, is often he that has stolen the treasure.
sentences.chinese: 最選喊抓賊的人，常常是偷了財寶的人。

sentences.english: He was later given an award for outstanding behavior for his role in capturing the thieves.
sentences.chinese: 後來，他因爲在抓賊過程中的突出表現而被授予榮譽。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
